LanguageData.Cults_TransmogrifiedLetterDesc: Tapping into powers unknown, {0} no longer seems quite the same and now holds strange vigor and size not seen before in its kind. {0} twitches with old and restless power.
LanguageData.Cults_AltarIsReserved: The altar is reserved by something else.
LanguageData.Cults_AltarNeedsToBeCleared: The altar is reserved by something else.
LanguageData.Cults_MorningEveningSermonInterrupted: The {0} sermon was cancelled. The congregation was offering up a sacrifice.
LanguageData.Cults_AlreadyGatheringForASermon: Your enclave is already gathering for a sermon.
LanguageData.Cults_NoWorshipWithoutDeity: Cannot worship without a deity selected
LanguageData.Cults_NewDarkYoung: A new-born dark young has crawled forth from the womb between worlds.
LanguageData.Cults_RatsMessage: Rats are bursting out from everywhere!
LanguageData.Cults_SpellDesc: Choose an ideal result you would like from your sacrifice.
LanguageData.Cults_AutoForbidWarning: Note: This will auto-forbid on normal research.
LanguageData.Cults_FoundedACultDesc: {0} has founded a cult.\n\nResearch and build an altar to hold congregations to expand your cult.
LanguageData.Cults_DismantledACultDesc: {0} has been dismantled.\n\nNot enough believers remain to continue the cult.
LanguageData.Cults_DiscoveredCultDesc: We have discovered {0}.\n\nThey are a cult from {1} founded by {2} and currenty led by {3}.
LanguageData.Cults_InitialExposureDesc: Stirred with new possibilities, your colonists have caught some interest in recent occult events.\n\nTheir beliefs can be tracked in their Needs menu. This belief will slowly decrease over time. Using occult research, you can strengthen the cult and the beliefs of your colonists until they found a cult of their own.
LanguageData.ForcedInvestigationDesc: If enabled, your best researcher will jump at the chance to research cult objects.
LanguageData.ShowDebugCodeDesc: In developer mode, this shows the debug code for cults. This displays additional information on calculations and processes as the mod goes on.
LanguageData.StudySuccessfulCultsIsRepeatableDesc: Enables repeatable research. When disabled, this allows players to use mods like tech GHXX's Tech Advancing.
LanguageData.RepeatableResearch: {0} can now be researched again to reinforce cult-mindedness.
LanguageData.WorshipCancelledCorruptionWarning: Scheduled worship cancelled due to a corrupted altar.
LanguageData.PruningSuccessful: Pruning and repairs were successfully completed.
LanguageData.PruneAndRepairDesc: Toggle this so that a colonist can root out the corrupted tree from the foundation, cut it into pieces, and repair the altar.
LanguageData.CorruptedAltarWarning: Your altar has become corrupted. Consider repairing it.
LanguageData.OverPawnRiderLimit: Too many riders! The maximum is {0}.
LanguageData.ReanimatedOath: {0} has fulfilled their oath and has risen again as a servant of Hastur.
LanguageData.GameOverAbsorptionByCarcosa: Your colony's curtain has fallen. These colonists were first to exit the stage of this world:\n\n{0}
LanguageData.CultSeed_NightmareTreeSummary: {0} has heard of a ghoulish looking tree nearby the colony and has gone off to investigate.
LanguageData.WritingStrangeSymbols: has begun obsessively writing pages of strange symbols.
LanguageData.CultBookSummary: {0} has no memory of the writing that is still slightly dampened from the sweat of their labors. It is a ghastly book filled with a strange alien language that is not readily understood.\n\nThe ominous looking diagrams of ritual sacrifices and spells within the tome has some colonists unnerved by its occult nature, whereas others have proposed setting up a proper research center to further study the secrets held within.
LanguageData.OccultCenterWarningOne: As {0} researches, {1} feels {3} sanity begin to slip.
LanguageData.OccultCenterWarningTwo: As {0} researches, {1} feels like someone is watching {2}.
LanguageData.OccultCenterWarningFour: During research, {0} has begun uttering unnatural sounds instead of speech.
LanguageData.CultistJoin: A {0} named NAME has arrived and is joining the colony. HECAP is a {1} obsessed in joining your new cult.
LanguageData.OfferingDesc: The offerer will gather any unforbiden food of this type.
LanguageData.OffererDesc: Choose a colonist to bring the offering.
LanguageData.AmountDesc:
Each amount is based on nutrition values.
Meagre: 5
Decent: 10
Sizable: 20
Worthy: 50
Impressive: 100
LanguageData.CommandOfferingDesc: Offer up valuable supplies in hope of gaining attention of forces beyond this world.
LanguageData.ExecutionerDesc: Choose a colonist to commit the act. During human sacrifices, this colonist, unless stated otherwise, receives the benefits of a spell.
LanguageData.SacrificeAnimalDesc: Choose an animal to offer their life.
LanguageData.SacrificeDesc: Choose a prisoner to offer their life.
LanguageData.AnimalSacrificeReason: to offer up livestock in their name
LanguageData.AnimalSacrificeWasPet: Sacrificing such an innocent-looking animal seems to please
LanguageData.AnimalSacrificeWasBonded: {0} had shared a bond with {1} during its lifetime, adding to its sacrificial value.
LanguageData.AnimalSacrificeWasExcMaster: Furthermore, {0}'s master, {1} carried out the sacrifice
LanguageData.UpgradeLevel2: Upgraded altar. Now we can carry out animal sacrifices in the name of the powers that be.
LanguageData.UpgradeLevel3: Upgraded altar. Now we can conduct human sacrifices in the name of the powers that be.
LanguageData.CommandUpgradeDesc: Add more blood channels and engravings to your altar to prepare it for more advanced rituals.
LanguageData.CommandCultSacrificeDesc: Sacrifice a poor soul to cosmic forces in hopes of grand rewards.
LanguageData.CommandCultDisabled: We don't know the proper rituals. We should research the proper rites.
LanguageData.CommandBuildFKCDesc: Set up a research center to further investigate the mysterious tome and its secrets.
LanguageData.DeityDesc: Deities can be discovered at the forbidden research center.
LanguageData.SacrificeIntro: Your colonists have gathered a sacrifice for
LanguageData.FavorDescription: Favor builds through repeated acts of devotion. Higher tiers unlock spells in return for human sacrifices.
LanguageData.PreacherDesc: This colonist addresses the congregation. Colonists with strong social skills are recommended.
LanguageData.CommandForceWorshipDesc: Call your enclave to worship, regardless of time or place.
LanguageData.MorningSermonsDesc: Host services between the hours of 6 and 10 o'clock in the morning.
LanguageData.EveningSermonsDesc: Host services between the hours of 6 and 10 o'clock at night.
LanguageData.NameCultMessage: A cult has begun to form in your colony. {0} thinks that you should give this cult a name.\n\nWhat should it be called?
LanguageData.NameCultMessageNullHandler: A cult has begun to form in your colony.\n\nWhat should it be called?
LanguageData.CultGainsName: The local cult is now known as {0}. It can be renamed at a local altar.
LanguageData.ForcedCrashCombatSuplier: Driven to insanity, the pilot of a trade ship crashlands nearby.
LanguageData.ForcedCrashExotic: Driven to insanity, the pilot of a trade ship crashlands nearby.
LanguageData.ForcedCrashBulkGoods: Driven to insanity, the pilot of a trade ship crashlands nearby.
LanguageData.DeepOnesArriveDesc: From the depths of the sea, the deep ones have emerged to defend your enclave from external threats.
LanguageData.LetterIncidentAurora: Every colonist is in awe of the aurora.\n\nFor a few days, some people's mood will be quite improved.
LanguageData.MessageSunkenShipChunkDrop: A chunk of a sunken ship has mysteriously emerged nearby.
LanguageData.GameOverSummonCthulhu:
At the crescendo of the ritual you feel a great power rising. Your chants increase in fervor and almost seem to multiply in number - as if you can hear petitioners from countless other worlds echo your own chant.

In retrospect you cannot recall quite when you were successful. Time, space, your own sense of self, ceased to be of significance. But you know now that the great one has arisen! Cthulhu is now no longer slumbering in his great city of R'lyeh. As a being beyond the simply material his presence and form is manifold. Will you be deemed faithful enough to be worthy of glimpsing his physical embodiment before your mind is ripped asunder?

Even now you struggle to maintain any level of lucidity as the laws by which the universe operates lapse into fantasy.

You've summoned Cthulhu! These colonists were first to be destroyed after his coming:

{0}
LanguageData.GameOverOrthogenesis:
The changes were slow and subtle at first. A loss of hair, a slight enlarging of the eyes, a growing greyish pallor of the skin. Some were more advanced than others and had small gill like slits appear. It was clear your genetic destiny wasn’t aligned with the rest of mankind's.

Now you hear the distant croaking of your newfound kindred. That sound that once made the night frightful, now feels familiar and welcoming. They are calling you home. You look at your belongings but decide to leave them behind. You won’t need them where you are going.

With the blessing of the great Father and Mother, who rule beneath the waves, you are now to join your brethren.

These colonists were lost to the waves:

{0}
LanguageData.GameOverTransdimensionalConvergence:
I make the signs, I speak the words
that openeth the door!
Come forth I say, I turn the Key,
Now ! walk the Earth once more !

You call her from the void.You call her away from the side of the Not-to-Be-Named-One. 

In the skies above you see a mist burst though, as if through a crack in the sky. Tendrils of a cloud-like substance reach down, which gives birth to eyes, teeth and limbs in a melange of biological excess.

You've opened the way for Shub Niggurath to take over your universe. These colonists were first to be destroyed after her coming

{0}
LanguageData.GameOverPilgrimageToKadath:
For the last few weeks the dreams have been getting stronger and more vivid. The real world began to pale in comparison. You would close your eyes to see its magnificent marble spires and silver fountains - the dream city of Kadath. There were those that thought that these visions were not real or that they were a lure for some trap. Even if that were true, you know you would still have sought it out.

And now Nyarlathotep has come to guide you to this paradise.

Nyarlathotep forced your colonists to sleep and visit Kadath. Therein, these colonists viewed Azathoth before promptly being destroyed from the madness that followed:

{0}
